titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the International Typographical Union, Local 6, Journal of Commerce Chapel WAG.276
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Tamiment Staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2015-02-17T13:13-0500

change.item: Edited by Maggie Schreiner to for DACS compliance and to reflect updated administrative information

did.unittitle: International Typographical Union, Local 6, Journal of Commerce Chapel

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

did.abstract: The International Typographical Union (ITU) was a trade union for the printing trade, founded in 1852. This collection consists of a reproduction of a membership ledger for one of the shops within the ITU Local 6.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: International Typographical Union. No. 6 (New York, N.Y.). Journel of Commerce Chapel.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The Tamiment Library does not have information about who owns copyright to this collection. Materials in this collection are expected to enter the public domain in 2082. The Tamiment Library is not authorized to grant permission to publish or reproduce materials from this collection.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Material found in collection; provenance is unknown. The accession number 1980.015 is associated with this collection.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; International Typographical Union, Local 6, Journal of Commerce Chapel; WAG 276; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of a reproduction of a membership ledger for one of the shops within the ITU Local 6. The ledger contains names of members, the dates they joined and left the union, each member's department or position, and other remarks.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: The International Typographical Union (ITU) was a trade union for the printing trade for newspapers and other media, founded in 1852. The ITU merged with the Communications Workers of America in 1987.
